intro: Pedicularis laxiflora, commonly known as the lax flowered lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic nature, relying on host plants for nutrients. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often resembling the shape of a louse, hence its common name. It thrives in alpine and subalpine habitats, often growing in rocky or sandy soils at high elevations. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, Pedicularis laxiflora is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
